meanings.definition: The quality of being ordinary or unremarkable.
meanings.sent1: The commonplacenesses of the room made it blend in with the others.
meanings.sent2: She preferred uniqueness over commonplacenesses in her artwork.
meanings.sent3: The commonplacenesses of the situation brought a sense of comfort.
meanings.sent4: His speech was filled with commonplacenesses, lacking any spark of originality.
meanings.sent5: The commonplacenesses of the landscape made it easy to forget.

meanings.definition: The state of lacking originality or uniqueness.
meanings.sent1: The artist's work was criticized for its commonplacenesses.
meanings.sent2: She strived to break free from the commonplacenesses of everyday life.
meanings.sent3: The commonplacenesses of the joke fell flat with the audience.
meanings.sent4: His writing was filled with commonplacenesses, lacking any fresh perspective.
meanings.sent5: The commonplacenesses of the design failed to impress the critics.
